title: Change in momentum from potential energy graph

content.question: Which of the following describes the magnitude of the momentum of the object in the first two straight-line segments shown in the graph as the object moves from point <math alttext="H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> to point <math alttext="J" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>J</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="H I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>H</mi><mi>I</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="I J" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>I</mi><mi>J</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> Zero Increasing

<math alttext="H I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>H</mi><mi>I</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="I J" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>I</mi><mi>J</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> Zero Decreasing

<math alttext="H I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>H</mi><mi>I</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="I J" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>I</mi><mi>J</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> Constant but nonzero Increasing

<math alttext="H I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>H</mi><mi>I</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="I J" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>I</mi><mi>J</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> Constant but nonzero Decreasing

content.answer: <math alttext="H I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>H</mi><mi>I</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="I J" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>I</mi><mi>J</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> Constant but nonzero Increasing

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
